reviews.sentence: Clean Spacious Room and Comfy Bed. My husband did the STP Seattle to Portland. Ride this past weekend and we booked this hotel for a 1 night stay after his 200 mile bike ride. Check in was fast and easy and staff was friendly. The room was spacious clean and the king size bed was very comfortable. We had no troubles falling asleep after such a long day and did not notice any airplane noise at all. We went out for dinner Saturday night after his ride and barely touched our food because we were exhausted after such a long day. We decided to pack it up so we could munch on it later. When we got back to our room we noticed there was no mini fridge or microwave. So unfortunately the food went to waste. They were able to accommodate our late check out request of 4 pm so we could go sight seeing for the day and leave his bike and our luggage in the room w out having to cart it around town. Husband is leery about leaving his bike on the car when we are out and about. There is no in room safe but we did not have anything of value besides his bike to lock up during this trip. Overall a nice pleasant stay.

Just OK. The runway facing rooms are not too loud. The rooms are old and below average when compared to other Sheratons I have stayed at. The elevator is fast there is sufficient parking but no on site laundry machines. Getting to the train was annoying you had have to take the shuttle to either the airport or the Aloft.

Location to the airport and to downtown PortlandWe were very disappointed to learn that dogs are allowed in all rooms of the hotel. We stayed on the fifth floor and heard a dog or dogs barking. Staff said if rooms on the first floor are full dogs are allowed in other rooms.

The food at the Bar Grill was excellent and the wait staff personnel were very friendly and attentive to my dining experience. The elevator employee was very friendly. The tile flooring in the bathroom was very cold to walk on. The wall mounted mirror had very poor lighting available. The design of the desk was not user friendly in that it did not have a drawer for note pad and pen.

Suite was awful. My son and ourselves mom and dad stayed in a suite at the Sheraton PDX. It was the worst suite we had ever stayed in and I do not think we will be back. The room was dark the décor was horrible and it looked like it had not been cleaned in months or housekeeping could not see the dirt and filth. The tables in the sitting room were so smeared and not clean under the glass that we could not have put any food on them. It was disgusting. The hallways had such an old and worn look to them as did the furnishings in the room. The tiles around the bathtub and shower had mildew on them and we could not hardly turn the faucet handles on the sink like they were rusted. And when we turned the hot handle it squeled so loud the other rooms had to hear it. The drain in the sink was all rusted around it also. The room had a real old smell to it when we walked in the room. We did not get in till three of the clock in the morning due to plane cancellations but we did not expect a suite to ever be like this in any hotel. The front desk was friendly and even offered a late check out for us but it was the room that was so poor. We have no idea how their other rooms are at that Sheraton but we feel the whole hotel need an update and better maintenance. To us there was no excuse especially when you are paying for a suite. Also there was hardly any plug ins for your cell phones. Would not like I said stay here again.

Consistently Dirty. I often stay here for business about 4 5x year. The hotel is fine but the rooms are consistently dirty. I have found trash on the floor hairs in the shower sheets etc. This last visit I had 2 hairs in my shower and 1 hair on my pillowcase when I checked in. gross. A colleague of mine had urine on her toilet seat upon checking in. Disappointing. Conference room services catering audio video setup etc are nice but I wish the overnight stay itself was more pleasant. I have returned multiple surveys to the hotel over the last few years complaining of cleanliness issues yet it continues to be a problem every time I stay there. Pros They allow pets. Parking is easy even when the conference rooms are all full.

Not ADA matched to our needs. Hotel under construction and rooms in system did not match descriptions of what they were as they were under construction and changing them out Was given an ADA room that was not acomodating as it only had rails in the shower and I asked specifically for rails around the toilet and lower bed. Had to wait while they juggled other ADA pl needs. HOTEL WATER being SHUT OFF next day for all day. THIS IS IMPORTANT TO KNOW when booking a hotel. Terribly inconvenient. GET YOUR UPDATES ABOUT THE HOTELS YOU ADVERTISE. I booked this hotel over the phone with Expedia Rep and no mention of hotel under construction. Never would of stayed there with an elderly of high needs for safety and wheelchair needs. Rooms that were remodeled were bright and cheery. Shopping Mall and good restaurants near by GET YOUR UPDATES ON WHAT THE HOTELS IS DOING. do not get a sale and just book someone take their care needs and be responsible with them.

Horrible. They never brought my soup but still tried charging. The staff member Alison was horibl. The rep Alison was uncompassionate that worked at the Sheraton. We just suffered a loss in our family and the folks at bokingcom were so accommodating and helpful. When the Sheraton tried finding our new reservation and could not they Alison basically was to bad and you need to contact booking to get it straight. Plus they charged us the same room rate for a weekend price. Would never stay there again.

Very disappointed in the motel room there is no desk or working space for a business traveler outdated and worn tub with fluctuating temperature toilet difficult to get room temp regulated and very open sterile lobby.

Easily met our expectations. Close to airport and prompt shuttle service. Great facilities including pool hot tub sauna and exercise room. The food and service at the bar and dining room were very good. It was quiet and provided everything we needed and then some.
Very Good. Updated furnishings lots of outlets. Noise from the hallway was loud. There is a gap under the door that allowed all the sound in. I could hear everytime the elevator bell rang.

location food sleep. stayed twice before after our trip. convenient for leaving our car for a week. very nice room and comfortable bed. updated finishes very contemporary. they even provide ear plugs in case the airplane sounds disturb you. nice lighting and linens. even a lighted makeup mirror. had a little issue but they more than made up for it in their excellent customer service. will stay there again.

Wonderful hotel and service. Every aspect was helpful. Drinks were available quickly accurate and on point. Exercise availability with the new cardio machines were more than sufficient. My room was clean and well maintained. Thank you.
The room is very nice and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Quick stopover with stay at airport. We flew in late at night and needed to pick up rental car in the morning. The shuttle was quick and convenient. Check in was fast and easy. The lobby was separate from rooms and the hallway to the elevators past the pool was carpeted and hard to pull suitcases across. The room was good sized although we did worry when there were ear plugs provided. We noticed some noise from takeoffs and landing. Internet was good. Our rental was at Alamo which was a short walk although the shuttle driver said he would have taken me there.
Good spot if stuck at airport. Rooms are clean and spacious.

Sorry excuse for a handicap room. I made reservations with the Sheraton 8 months before my trip. I requested a ADA room with a roll in shower. I use arm crutches to walk most of the time due to my MS. I am unable to lift my leg over the tub even with the help of a rail. When I got to my room I called and ask if this was there ADA room and was told yes. Spent 4 days washing my hair in the sink and doing sponge baths. For being a Sheraton I was deeply disappointed. Room definitely not worth the price. The weekend breakfast buffet was very good when they had food on it. There were two big groups staying and the restaurant kitchen was very unprepared. Staff was very nice and did the best they could.

The facilities were nice. It was a much smaller venue than the convention center Kimouricon but perfect for what their need was Fandom PDX. Plenty of space for the panels and various workshops. The pool seemed nice and I would have loved to have used it especially for some sort of activity. IDK why so many girls pay for pool and then have barely any use. it is a disappointment. Although I did not stay in any room the lobby was nice. You walk in and can be greeted by their staff they have plenty of seating or at least had plenty of seating till it got crowded for 20 people. They also had a full service bar with food which was consistently crowded.
